intro: Adicea pavonii, commonly known as the rainbow cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, colorful spines that range from red to purple, giving it its common name. The plant features a short, thick stem with clusters of small, fleshy leaves. It produces yellow flowers during the warmer months, adding to its ornamental appeal. Adicea pavonii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient choice for xeriscaping.
